utility.jaccard_similarity(set1, set2)[source]¶

Calculate Jaccard index of two sets. If both sets are empty, return 0. :param set1: first set :type set1: set :param set2: second set :type set2: set

Returns:

Jaccard index of two sets

Return type:

jaccard_index (float)

utility.normalize_clusters(cluster)[source]¶

Normalize cluster dictionary, starting dictionary has nodes as keys and communities as values Returns dictionary where keys are communities identifiers, values are lists of nodes in that community. :param cluster: dictionary where keys are nodes, values are community assignments :type cluster: dict

Returns:

dictionary where keys are community identifiers, values are lists of nodes in that community

Return type:

normalized_cluster (dict)

Examples

cluster = {1: 0, 2: 0, 3: 1, 4: 1} normalize_clusters(cluster) -> {0: [1, 2], 1: [3, 4]}
